entry.title: First batch currently in production!
entry.content:
“Good news everyone!” the first batch of HopperHawk v1.0 is now in production! Once assembly/testing is complete at the factory I will update my stock/inventory on Tindie. Be sure to order quickly! Round one is limited to 10 units (based on pre-orders and interest through Reddit).

If you haven’t already, sign up for the waitlist on Tindie! As soon as the stock is available you’ll receive an email and a chance to order. The base unit which includes the board and sensor will cost $50. You’ll be able to add the case for an additional $10 (which also includes free assembly). All units will be flashed and ready to setup once you receive them!

If you have any questions, be sure to reach out: joe@sidelinedata.com

entry.title: Website, Blog, and v1.0 Launch!
entry.content:
Welcome! I have been working on HopperHawk on and off in my (limited) free time for a while now, and have finally reached a point where I can share it with others!

Version 1.0

Specifications

  • Based on the ESP32
  • Support for an 18650 Lithium Ion battery
  • Uses the TOF10120 sensor for measurements
  • Has a BCM to support charging/load sharing
  • Includes two onboard LEDs to indicate power and charging status
  • USB-C port for power
  • Headers for USB TTL communication (to flash) and to put into BOOT mode

Background

HopperHawk started as a project for myself, and I never intended on releasing it out into the world. It’s also the first project that involved building custom PCBs, so when I started out I went as simple as possible to reduce complexity and cost. The project gained some traction and more people were interested in it than I expected. After several iterations and hardware changes, it is finally in a place where I can share it with others!
